expression: like two peas in a pod

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: like two peas in a pod

step1.sentence: My grandmother always said my mother and I were like two peas in a pod — same expressions, same stubborn streak.

step2.story: The two engineers had worked together for seven years and had developed an almost telepathic shorthand. Their colleagues joked that they were like two peas in a pod — one started a sentence and the other finished it without looking up from the whiteboard.

step3.story: Nobody could explain exactly when Lily and Sam had become best friends. They had sat next to each other on the first day of first grade and had never seemed to sit anywhere else. They dressed differently, listened to completely different music, and disagreed on almost every movie — yet they were like two peas in a pod in ways that mattered more: how they handled disappointment, how seriously they took fairness, how they showed up without being asked when the other one needed them. Their mothers joked that the friendship would outlast both families combined, and there was no reason to doubt it.

meaning.shortExampleEn: Those twins are like two peas in a pod.
